text: In statistics, a central tendency (or 'measure of central tendency') is a central or typical value for a probability distribution.Weisberg H.F 1992. Central tendency and variability, p2. Sage University Paper Series on Quantitative Applications in the Social Sciences. Measures of central tendency are often called averages.Upton G. & Cook I. 2008. Oxford dictionary of statistics. OUP (entry for "central tendency"). The most common measures of central tendency are the arithmetic mean, the median and the mode. ==References== Category:Statistics
title: Central tendency
